Name: Raising the maximum age to apply to become a firefighter.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to raising the maximum age to apply to become a firefighter
BodyName: Committee on Fire and Criminal Justice Services

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Fire and Criminal Justice Services
This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
History.BodyName: Committee on Fire and Criminal Justice Services

History.Description: This Introduction was Amendment Proposed by Comm
History.BodyName: Committee on Fire and Criminal Justice Services

History.Description: This Introduction was Laid Over by Committee
History.BodyName: Committee on Fire and Criminal Justice Services

History.Description: This Introduction was Filed (End of Session)

Summary: This bill would raise the maximum eligible age for applying to become a firefighter from 29 to 31, and establish that the maximum eligible age to begin working as a firefighter is 36.
Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:
      Section 1. Paragraph 3 of subdivision a of section 15-103 of the administrative code of the city of New York, as amended by local law number 24 for the year 1968, is amended to read as follows:
      3. Shall have passed his or her [eighteenth] 18th birthday but not his or her [twenty-ninth] 31st birthday on the date of the filing of his or her application for civil service examination and not his or her 36th birthday on the date of his or her commencing employment as a firefighter. [No person who qualifies under this requirement shall be disqualified from membership in the department because of having passed his or her twenty-ninth birthday subsequent to the filing of his or her application.] However no person shall be appointed unless he or she shall have attained his or her twenty-first birthday.
      ï¿½2.   This local law takes effect immediately.
BC
LS 3018
10/12/16
